title: Wasserstein convergence rates in the invariance principle for sequential dynamical systems
abstract: In this paper, we consider the convergence rate with respect to the Wasserstein distance in the invariance principle for sequential dynamical systems. We utilize and modify the techniques previously employed for stationary sequences to address our non-stationary case. Under certain assumptions, we can apply our result to a large class of dynamical systems, including sequential $Î²_n$-transformations, piecewise uniformly expanding maps with additive noise in one-dimensional and multidimensional case, and so on.
comment: 24 pages, no figure. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1406.4266 by other authors
